title: How to Make Handy Duct Tape Strips

steps.headline: Gather all the materials you'll need.
steps.description: Get a surface that you can cut on. A cutting board or workbench works nicely.

steps.headline: Cut strips of duct tape about 1 inch (2.5 cm) wider than the parchment paper.
steps.description: Affix these to the parchment paper, width wise.

steps.headline: Repeat the process to make as many strips as you want.
steps.description: Make sure to leave some space between the strips.

steps.headline: Cut along the edge of the duct tape strips with a knife/scissors.
Cut off the excess duct tape at the sides and ends of the parchment paper.
Fold up your strips and put them in your pocket, pack, wallet, etc.

text: Gather all the materials you'll need. Get a surface that you can cut on. A cutting board or workbench works nicely. Roll out some parchment paper.  Cut strips of duct tape about 1 inch (2.5 cm) wider than the parchment paper. Affix these to the parchment paper, width wise. Repeat the process to make as many strips as you want. Make sure to leave some space between the strips. Cut along the edge of the duct tape strips with a knife/scissors.  Cut off the excess duct tape at the sides and ends of the parchment paper.  Fold up your strips and put them in your pocket, pack, wallet, etc.  Finished.
